question_text: What is the general process to remove a memory module from a desktop motherboard?
answer_options: Twist the module clockwise and pull
Lift the CPU cooler and pull up the RAM
Release the side locks and pull the module straight out
Loosen the screws around the memory slot
correct_answer: Release the side locks and pull the module straight out
explanation: To remove a DIMM, press the side locks outward; the module will lift slightly, allowing you to remove it.
